intro: Croton churutensis, commonly known as the Churutensis Croton, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often strikingly colorful members. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, paddle-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
